verbose_text: Although this case was considered ABPA or obstructive bronchial aspergillosis, we diagnosed the patient with ITBA because of findings inconsistent with ABPA, such as the development of acute respiratory failure, increased CRP levels, the presence of many fungal hyphae but no evidence of eosinophils (allergic mucin) in the sputum, and the absence of serum antibodies against Aspergillus IgG.
